wikipedia_page.main: Henry Digby Beste (1768–1836) was an English writer and aristocrat, who converted to Catholicism. He is seen as a precursor to the Oxford Movement.

response: *Henry Digby Beste  (1768–1836), English writer and aristocrat

There is a lengthy description of the School under Mr Hewthwaite, who was the master from 1765-91, by Henry Digby Beste in his Personal and Literary Memorials. "Beste" Personal and Literary Memorials 1829. Beste, who was at the school from 1776 to 1783, did not particularly enjoy his time at the school complaining about the floggings that took place and the lack narrow curriculum that was taught, being mainly Latin and Greek. Beste provides a description of the school:
